plants.name: Rhododendron ponticum
plants.description: An evergreen shrub known for its vibrant clusters of bell-shaped flowers. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodlands and mountainous areas.
plants.funFact: Rhododendron ponticum is known to form dense thickets that can dominate and reduce biodiversity in some regions where it is invasive.

plants.name: Cassia fistula
plants.description: A tropical to subtropical tree famous for its cascading clusters of bright yellow flowers that cover the entire tree, usually blooming spectacularly in late spring.
plants.funFact: The Golden Shower Tree is the national tree of Thailand and its flowers are used in traditional medicine.

plants.name: Lupinus perennis
plants.description: A native wildflower in North America with tall spikes covered in pea-like blossoms. Commonly found in sandy soils and pine barrens.
plants.funFact: Lupines enrich the soil by fixing nitrogen, benefiting the surrounding plant community.

plants.name: Magnolia grandiflora
plants.description: An evergreen tree with large, fragrant white flowers that bloom in late spring through summer. Common in warm temperate regions.
plants.funFact: Southern Magnolia flowers can be up to 12 inches in diameter and have a lemony fragrance.
